content: squared flowers mobius cowl or shawl a mobius is basically a circle with one twist in the foundation row or first round it becomes a figure 8 that allows us to work the top side and the bottom side of the circle at the same time this pattern is intermediate because of the mobius design it is easier to wrap your head around the structure of a mobius project if you are already comfortable with basic crochet stitches and patterns if you have never done a mobius before i recommend watching a few videos online to get familiar with the concept this pattern is very versatile you can use any yarn weight and corresponding hook size and you can make any size foundation loop to achieve your desired project to make my example scarf you will need - 1 ball of yarn bee sweet divinity or about 250 yards of a #3 lightweight yarn i used blush - 5mm hook to make the example shawl you will need -1 cake of caron skinny cakes or about 800 yards of a #3 lightweight yarn i used turkish delight -5mm hook stitch abbreviations chain chain double_crochet double_crochet dtc double treble_crochet st stitch slip_stitch slip_stitch space space chain space chain space skip skip hey sister designs 2022 - 1 - special stitches dtc yarn over 3 times insert hook and pull up a loop yarn over pull through 2 loops x4 notes instructions are given according to #3 yarn and the mobius scarf length to adjust the length of your cowl simply create more or less foundation ovals the ovals must be in a multiple of 2 to make the larger mobius measure your body circumference around your upper arms add 2 more inches to make a tighter fitting shrug add 6 or more inches to make a loose fitting shawl create your foundation ovals in multiples of 2 until your chain reaches this measurement before joining together i have included a photo of each row at the end of this document to begin r1 - make a slip knot ch6 1dtc in the first chain ch5 1dtc in previous oval x29 slip_stitch into 1st chain making sure the ovals are not twisted r2 - slip_stitch into first oval working under the chain 5s ch3 2dc ch2 3dc ch2 single_crochet ch2 in next oval * 3dc ch2 3dc ch2 in next loop single_crochet ch2 in next oval * repeat all the way around when you finish the last oval do not slip_stitch or join the round double check that your ovals are all straight flip the first oval down toward you bringing the dtc to the top continue working the repeat pattern into each oval again this time under the dtc slip_stitch to the top of beginning ch3 to close each oval should be a mirror of the first half double_crochet ovals will have dcs and single_crochet ovals will have single_crochet you will be looking at the right side of the stitches on
